Title: Raipur civic body unveils ambitious budget for 2024-25, prioritizing youth, environment, and urban development
Body:
RAIPUR: Raipur Municipal Corporation (RMC) budget, presented by Mayor Aijaz Dhebar on Wednesday promises to establish a 'World Skill Centre' to provide skill training to youth, create a Buffer Clean Corridor for environmental conservation, and introduce 100 new electric buses for the city.Presenting a Rs 57.71 lakh surplus budget for fiscal 2024-25, Mayor Dhebar also announced plans for city development, arrangements to reduce pollution, and promotion of art and culture.Before presenting the budget, the Mayor, carrying the briefcase, arrived at the Kali Mandir situated at Akashvani Square to seek blessings.As per budget proposals, youths will receive skill training and will be connected with employment-oriented programmes. They will be provided with employment opportunities according to their natural talents, qualifications, and acquired skills, allowing them to choose their careers with respect and dignity.He said a plan is in progress for the development of the Mahadev Ghat area to preserve its religious and cultural significance. Under this plan, basic facilities will be expanded and beautified for visitors, developing it as a tourist spot, with a sum of Rs 5 crore rupees allocated for this purpose.A Dog Shelter will be constructed for Rs 50 lakh to house stray dogs to deal with the situation of stray dog menace. Following the regulations of the central and state governments, arrangements will be made for the care, treatment, and rehabilitation of sick and injured dogs under the supervision of veterinary doctors.A 'Centre for Art and Culture' will be established for Rs 5 crore in the Corporation area to provide a platform for practitioners and budding artists. 
Training will be provided to budding artists under the guidance of traditional art and music teachers. Additionally, suitable locations will be provided for activities related to traditional and modern promotional techniques, such as recording scripting, production-related training, and work.A Yoga Centre, Gym, and Park will be built for Rs 5 crore. The need for community buildings in PM Aawas Yojana residential Complexes is also recognized and a plan has been prepared for the construction of community buildings according to the residents' expectations. Additionally, arrangements will be made to enhance the maintenance of these complexes with greenery.The Municipal Corporation plans to establish a business complex with a Yoga Centre, Gym, Park, and sports field for Rs 5 crore, along with a skill training centre.A plan is underway to construct three mini stadiums for Rs 6 crore in the next fiscal year. These constructions will provide suitable venues for small and medium-scale events for all age groups and will nurture new talents through creative activities.To enhance Raipur's identity, attractive entrance gates will be built at seven locations for Rs 4 crore. Buffer clean corridors for pollution control will be developed at the city's entrance gates for Rs 7 crore, providing facilities for small vendors.Underpasses will be developed for Rs 1 crore under the expressway passing near the city. Smart streets will be built within the city for Rs 8 crore, featuring uniformity in special colors, underground cables, wide roads, covered drains, and vending points.Various parks will be constructed and redeveloped for Rs 8 crore, developed as theme gardens. Multi-Activity Centers along with Convention Centers will be built for Rs 10 crore in Raipur.'Appu House' will open for children for 10 crore rupees, and work will be carried out for the maintenance and renovation of parks in Raipur city. The Municipal Corporation of Raipur has decided to start the construction and operation of the proposed 'Appu House' this year to provide suitable places for children's recreation.A Sports Academy will be established in Raipur this year. Players from the region will receive training in this academy, and indoor weightlifting athletes will be provided with suitable opportunities. Progress grounds of Raipur City will be developed to organize indigenous fairs and other events.Efforts are being made to enhance revenue in all 10 zones of the Municipal Corporation area. It has been decided that 25% of the total revenue from each zone will be allocated for its development.A proposal of Rs 50 lakh has been prepared in this fiscal year to strengthen the street lighting system, which will be sent to the state government. Provision has been made for the development and beautification of urban ponds, parks, and public places in this fiscal year.Considering the increasing population of dogs and the damages caused to citizens, provisions are being made to provide dog catchers in every zone. The RMC is making continuous efforts to save citizens from accidents caused by stray animals. This financial year, provision has been made to deploy human resources separately for catching stray animals in all zones.Arrangements will be made for two mobile public toilets in every zone of the municipal corporation. A city forest will be constructed near Sarona's trenching ground to control the air pollution occurring there.Proposals will be sent to the government for the appointment of over 50 sanitation workers in each ward to improve the cleanliness system. Upgradation work will be done for damaged toilets in Raipur city. Additionally, maintenance work will be carried out with the amount received for maintenance as per the Pay and Use facility for the upcoming time.Given this, a decision has been taken to form a high-level monitoring committee. This committee will review the regular monitoring of maintenance and operational activities that have been completed. The mayor, commissioner, and other public representatives will be included in this committee.Construction work for organic compost pits will be carried out in all vegetable markets of the city. Security personnel will be appointed for the maintenance of parks. Biological treatment of all major ponds will be done. High street development work will be carried out at the cost of Rs 10 crore on the banks of ponds.For Rs 8 crore, a Mini Time Square will be constructed in the middle of Jaistambh Chowk from Telibandha/IT/City Kotwali to Raipur city.The Mayor said that the need for picnic spots within the city is being felt, so a city picnic point will be constructed for Rs 5 crore. Boating, play zone, cooking zone, relaxation zone, etc., will be prepared. The plan is to develop Indira Smriti Udyan as a city picnic point.The Mayor informed that this time the estimated target for revenue collection in Raipur Municipal Corporation is set at Rs 241,74,30000.Key points:A plan for the development of Mahadev Ghat area, a Dog Shelter, and a 'Center for Art and Culture' are included in the budget.For Raipur city, the operation of 100 new electric buses is planned for this financial year.Infrastructure development projects such as the construction of mini stadiums, entrance gates, underpasses, and smart streets are planned.Initiatives for children, including the opening of 'Appu House' and a Sports Academy, are highlighted.Efforts for revenue enhancement, street lighting improvement, and urban development are emphasized.Plans for waste management, sanitation, and public transport improvement, including the operation of Metro Light Train, are mentioned.Arrangements will be made for the operation of the Metro Light Train to accelerate public transport in the city. Efforts will be made to complete this Rs 500 crore project through the PPP mode.Projects for organic waste management, electric buses, and the development of picnic spots are outlined.The target for revenue collection in Raipur Municipal Corporation is set at Rs 241,74,30000.Budget Estimate for 2024-25

Title: TVS tollgate flyover in Trichy to get LED rope lights
Body:
Trichy: As part of beautifying the major entry points of Trichy city, the City Corporation has allocated `12.7 lakh to illuminate and enhance the aesthetic appeal of the TVS tollgate flyover. Situated at the intersection of the Chennai-Trichy-Madurai NH and Trichy-Pudukottai NH, the flyover will receive LED rope lights in two different capacities to illuminate the space below, which has been redeveloped as a green area.
Located in ward 47 in zone II, the TVS tollgate flyover and the roads passing through the locality are frequently accessed by VVIPs visiting Trichy airport and the circuit house near the zonal corporation office. Due to the vacant space below the flyover being misused for open urination, the area has been fenced to prevent the floating population waiting at bus stops from polluting the space.
The civic body plans to install 6-watt LED rope lights below the flyover to decorate the green space at night. Modern lights will be installed on a trial basis at 16 locations. Additionally, two new water fountains have been developed in the space below the flyover and adorned with decorative plants. Officials said that the water fountains were installed based on the suggestions of the National Clean Air Programme (NCAP) to reduce air pollution caused by vehicle emissions at major road intersections.
Similarly, an additional Rs 8.4 lakh has been allocated for extra lights on the center median connecting the TVS tollgate with the Head Post Office (HPO) traffic signal in Cantonment. Approximately 110 LED lights are planned to be installed.
